DataElement.preferredName: PET Series Decay Factor 6 digits 2 Decimal Number
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The decay factor is used to scale the image. Required if Decay Correction (0054,1102) is other than NONE. If decay correction is applied, all images in the Series shall be decay corrected to the same time.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The decay factor is used to scale the image. Required if Decay Correction (0054,1102) is other than NONE. If decay correction is applied, all images in the Series shall be decay corrected to the same time.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A technique for measuring the gamma radiation produced by collisions of electrons and positrons (anti-electrons) within living tissue. In positron emission tomography (PET), a subject is given a dose of a positron-emitting radionuclide attached to a metabolically active substance (for example, 2-fluoro-2-deoxy-D-glucose (FDG), which is similar to a naturally occurring sugar, glucose, with the addition of a radioactive fluorine atom). When living tissue containing the positron emitter is bombarded by electrons, gamma radiation produced by collisions of electrons and positrons is detected by a scanner, revealing in fine detail the tissue location of the metabolically-active substance administered.:No value exists.

Concepts.definition: A technique for measuring the gamma radiation produced by collisions of electrons and positrons (anti-electrons) within living tissue. In positron emission tomography (PET), a subject is given a dose of a positron-emitting radionuclide attached to a metabolically active substance (for example, 2-fluoro-2-deoxy-D-glucose (FDG), which is similar to a naturally occurring sugar, glucose, with the addition of a radioactive fluorine atom). When living tissue containing the positron emitter is bombarded by electrons, gamma radiation produced by collisions of electrons and positrons is detected by a scanner, revealing in fine detail the tissue location of the metabolically-active substance administered.
A collection of images with a common element.

Property.preferredDefinition: A gradual deterioration or decline to an inferior state.:Factor; anything that contributes causally to a result.

Concepts.definition: A gradual deterioration or decline to an inferior state.
Anything that contributes causally to a result.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

DataElementConcept.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 8/28/10 added concept for decay; remove SUV concept.  1/4/2010 Created for Image SUV IMGCRF module.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Value expressed as a number with 6 total digits with 2 digits after the decimal. [Manually-curated]

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Six Mathematics Digits 2 Decimal Place Number
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: No value exists.:No Value Exists:No Value Exists:An indication of the specific number of digits to be expected to the right of the decimal point in a line of numbers.:Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification.

Concepts.definition: An indication of the specific number of digits to be expected to the right of the decimal point in a line of numbers.
A numeral or string of numerals expressing value, quantity, or identification.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 10/13/2015 removed upside down question mark from change note. jk  2/10/12 FBPP content retired per Jenny Larkin (NHLBI); VD reused by other context (DCP, CCR) and kept released.  5/4/07 - versioned to use concepts that better represent a 6 digit 2 decimal number; 12/14/06-to support the NHLBI-FBPP

DataElement.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine
DataElement.changeDescription: 5/31/11 - corrected definition; wrong DICOM definition had been used when last revised.  8/28/10 updated for revised DEC.  1/4/2010 - created for IMGCRF Image SUV module
